references.reason: This paper is foundational in establishing the model for analyzing value-maximizing autobidders in online advertising auctions, a core topic of the target paper.

references.paper_title: The landscape of auto-bidding auctions: Value versus utility maximization
references.reason: This paper provides a comprehensive overview of the shift in bidding behavior from utility to value maximization, which is central to the theoretical framework of the target paper.

references.paper_title: Towards efficient auctions in an auto-bidding world
references.reason: This paper initiates the study of hierarchical structures in autobidding auctions, which the target paper builds upon and extends theoretically.

references.paper_title: Efficiency of the first-price auction in the autobidding world
references.reason: This paper empirically demonstrates the negative impact of sophisticated autobidders on auction efficiency, which motivates the target paper's theoretical investigation.

references.paper_title: Efficiency of non-truthful auctions in auto-bidding: The power of randomization
references.reason: This paper presents a rigorous analysis of first-price auctions with value-maximizing bidders, providing a benchmark for the target paper's fine-grained analysis.
